title: Did Congress Expel 14 Members for Supporting Confederacy, Not Acknowledging Lincoln as President?
subtitle: There is a history of House and Senate members being kicked out, but did the reasons bear any resemblance to political events in 2020?
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: In 1861, three U.S. House members and 11 Senators were expelled for supporting the Confederacy and not acknowledging Abraham Lincoln's election as president.
